text: Sylhet-5 is a constituency represented in the Jatiya Sangsad (National Parliament) of Bangladesh since 2019 by Hafiz Ahmed Mazumder of the Awami League. == Boundaries == The constituency encompasses Kanaighat and Zakiganj upazilas. == History == The constituency was created for the first general elections in newly independent Bangladesh, held in 1973. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1973 | D. M. H Obaidur Raza Chowdhury | Independent |- | | 1979 | Hasnath Sohe Hai | |- |style="background-color:" | | 1986 | Hasnat Mohammad Abdul Hai | Jatiya Party |- |style="background- color:" | | 1988 | Mahmudur Rahman Majumdar | Jatiya Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1991 | Obaidul Haque | Islami Oikya Jote |- |style="background-color:" | | Feb 1996 | Abdul Kahir Chowdhury | Bangladesh Nationalist Party |- |style="background-color:" | | Jun 1996 | Hafiz Ahmed Mazumder | Awami League |- |style="background-color:" | | 2001 | Farid Uddin Chowdhury | Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami |- |style="background-color:" | | 2008 | Hafiz Ahmed Mazumder | Awami League |- |style="background-color:" | | 2014 | Salim Uddin | Jatiya Party (Ershad) |- |style="background-color:" | | 2018 | Hafiz Ahmed Mazumder | Awami League |- |} == Elections == === Elections in the 2010s === Salim Uddin was elected unopposed in the 2014 general election after opposition parties withdrew their candidacies in a boycott of the election. === Elections in the 2000s === === Elections in the 1990s === == References == ==External links== * Category:Parliamentary constituencies in Bangladesh Category:Sylhet District
title: Sylhet-5
